Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can illustrate a scenario where two people are trying to communicate over a distance with noticeable separation between them.
The student can accurately draw a string telephone, with cups at both ends and a connecting string.
The student can depict arrows or lines to show how sound travels from one cup to the other along the string.
The student can effectively show that the device can relay information from one person to another.
The student can represent the materials, such as string and cups, in the drawing.
The student can provide a basic explanation alongside the drawing about how the string telephone resolves the communication problem using sound.
CANNOT: The student may have minor issues with the clarity or precision of arrows or lines indicating sound travel (e.g., arrows might not be perfectly straight or consistent).
The student might not label all parts of the drawing, such as failing to label the string or cups (student assumes it's self-explanatory).
The student might omit details in the explanation, such as specific acoustic properties involved (e.g., vibrations in the string), due to focusing mostly on the practical operation.
